documents.document: @wesnice Good luck with your permits! #hikerchat
A15 #hikerchat Snowshoeing in the local mtns. Hoping to get to Baker w/ fresh snow! @TETONsports @Discover_MBS https://t.co/tBqToWW6zw
A13 #hikerchat Super thick mud, 5am screeching eagles and Ravens stealing our snacks @OlympicNP overnight along the west coast @TETONsports
@TETONsports He's learning abt better layering! And has noticed how much work it is to get out for a weekend together. #hikerchat
A8 #hikerchat Our best friend surprised us at the summit of Mt Whitney to celebrate our completion of the JMT hike @fullvanfun #bestfriends
A7 con't I do make him pack his own clothes tho there have been a few trips that he's shivered....#hikerchat @TETONsports
A7 #hikerchat I usually do the prep. Hubby hasn't caught on to all the details necessary to complete @TETONsports
A6 #hikerchat My husband @danpulsifer in full hiker beard. He's got the loudest, scariest yell I know! @fullvanfun
I hugged the first tree I saw on my way down from Mt Whitney summit! #hikerchat @WidowVoyages @TETONsports @TheHikingDiva @bushwhackingfoo
A5 #hikerchat I took a friend up Railroad Grade at Mt Baker. Not too long, good overnight location w/ explore ops @TETONsports
@TETONsports @k2rm Except when siblings didn't get the outdoor bug and whine and complain the whole time... :P #hikerchat
A4 #hikerchat Excellent knowledge and experience with backpacking. More relaxing when I don't have to spend time teaching @fullvanfun
A3 #hikerchat Able to keep up with my pace, able to work together in camp, able to entertain each other @TETONsports
A2 #hikerchat All of the above! Always feel safer hiking w/ someone and can bring more goodies when can distribute the load @fullvanfun
Of course I'd really love a furry companion one dat. Keep hoping for a pack alpaca. @TETONsports #hikerchat @TETONsports
A1 I'm out w/ my hubby as often as our schedules allow. We went on a week-long hike within a month of mtg #hikerchat https://t.co/XtZyuMoRtv
I'm here for #hikerchat. Popping in and out between work assignments! @TETONsports
Got my @ParksCanada Free Pass today! Can't wait to explore our National Parks #hikerchat #parkchat #Canada150
.@gcouros Set them up in an edu chat so they get to connect with others right away.
Thanks for hosting @Hiker_Steve & @Bernardine. Look forward to the next one. G’night from the Left coast! #CDNHikeChat
A10 #CDNHikeChat Always try to hit up a local craft brewery after a hike! @Bernardine
.@Hiker_Steve Dang! I’m not at home with my pirate gear #CDNHikeChat #Ahoy
.@Hiker_Steve @kristapetrie @MelodramaBabs Our last day was summiting Mt. Whitney, 14505’! https://t.co/aomfG72PTu #CDNHikeChat
A8 #CDNHikeChat "Walks long miles in high places” :D Still waiting for my trail name... @Hiker_Steve @Bernardine
.@kristapetrie @Hiker_Steve And catching the occasional view of the ISS! @NASA #CDNHikeChat
.@kristapetrie @MelodramaBabs Hiked in the Sierras of California last summer. Crazy altitude high! Really changes hike speed #CDNHikeChat
A7 #CDNHikeChat Was glad when Jasper Nat’l became a Dark Sky Preserve. Beautiful to mix stars & mtns #DarkSky @Hiker_Steve
.@Hiker_Steve @Bernardine Nope! Thank goodness for hiking poles! #CDNHikeChat
.@Hiker_Steve @Bernardine Absolutely! I’m fast through the forest sections, and on the trip out. Slow down for the views and stop for lakes!
A6 Extra. Made it down from Berg Lake (Mt Robson) in personal record best of 5 hours (20 km) #CDNHikeChat @Bernardine @Hiker_Steve
A6 #CDNHikeChat I’m definitely guilty of being a hare! Tend to leave hiking partners in the dust... @Bernardine @Hiker_Steve
A5 #CDNHikeChat Looks like the cute sandpiper from the @DisneyPixar short! @Hiker_Steve https://t.co/NfCNV2DRr6
A4 #CDNHikeChat Leave no trace! :P @Bernardine @Hiker_Steve
#CDNHikeChat Good old blue tarp from @CanadianTire! Worth the weight on some trips @Hiker_Steve @Bernardine
A3 #CDNHikeChat Gotten good at stringing up shelter tarps here in the PacNW. Never know when it’ll rain @Hiker_Steve @Bernardine
#CDNHikeChat @MelodramaBabs Def want to invest in a lightweight spinner or fly rod to take backcountry! @Bernardine
A2 #CDNHikeChat Fished & ate this summer along the JMT. Great way to supplement calories. https://t.co/y4V4gseaVg @Bernardine @Hiker_Steve
A1 #CDNHikeChat Lots of sea kayak opps on our coast. Bowren Lakes is really popular for canoes @Hiker_Steve
Woot Woot! I'm here for #CDNHikeChat from just outside Vancouver @Hiker_Steve #BeautifulBC
A4 #HikerChat Either somewhere local and easy or somewhere mountainous and snowy! Depends on weather and energy @HikerChat @TETONsports
A5 @Wilderness1967 Definitely agree w/ burritos... all sorts of colourful ingredients rolled up together! #hikerchat
#HikerChat A7 Lots of @icebreakernz layers. Merino keeps you warm even when sweaty! @TETONsports @HikerChat
.@RCGibby73 @HikerChat I love this reply. I think this is how I'm feeling these days too #hikerchat #optoutside
#HikerChat A13 Hiking is a pretty isolated/isolating activity. It's important to connect and know we're not alone! @TETONsports
Once again catching up late to #hikerchat. Wish I didn't have to be at work! Looks like it was a great chat! @TETONsports
Thanks @Flow397 & @59NationalParks for another great #ParkChat! Just getting bigger & bigger! #nps101 #FindYourPark
A11 #ParkChat Def hard to describe! Peace, joy, satisfaction, excitement… #oneofakind @Flow397
.@Flow397 In Mineral King hikers wrap chicken wire to keep our marmots #ParkChat @SequoiaKingsNPS
.@akonthego Been using @AlaskaAir pts to go to Cali. Maybe we need to start looking North… #parkchat @alaskatravlnews @DenaliNPS
A9 #ParkChat pt.2 Hoping to go to Nfld this summer and get to Gros Morne Nat,l Park thx to air miles. @ParksandPoints #Canada150
A9 #ParkChat Plan the big trips years ahead and save up miles. Use credit for everything! @ParksandPoints
A8 #ParkChat I shared daypack tips on my blog last spring: https://t.co/QAcxJZgUcm Of course the 10 essentials most hikes! @ParksandPoints
A7 #ParkChat We plan to snack lots and cook as many meals as possible. Camping in Nat’l Forest sites saves $$ too @ParksandPoints
A6 #ParkChat @NCascadesNPS, the American Alps, is a best kept secret! Didn't know it was in my backyard for a few years @ParksandPoints
A4 #Parkchat A lot of my fav hidden gems are a night or two into the backcountry. Esp high alpine lakes @ParksandPoints
@playoutsidegal @ParksandPoints @YellowstoneNPS I once woke up to a herd of elk outside my tent in Jasper Nat’l Park. Can’t imagine a bison!
@melissa_sue @ParksandPoints @YosemiteNPS Which road did you come in on? I love coming from the east through Tioga Pass #ParkChat
A3 #ParkChat I was incredibly wowed & impressed by Treeline Lake just before Mt Whitney @SequoiaKingsNPS… https://t.co/bfxEiCazp4
So true! @rscottjones A lot of great spots are in the Nat’l Forests & Wilderness around the parks @ParksandPoints
A2 #ParkChat Off the beaten path, quiet during high season, special vibes https://t.co/zkuP5V68Q6
Please explain moose church! @MissouriHowell @59NationalParks @NatlParkService @GrandTetonNPS #ParkChat
We got into @YosemiteNPS last summer on my dad-in-laws senior pass! @melissa_sue @59NationalParks @NatlParkService @brian_heyman
A1 #ParkChat Planning on overnight hike so we could summit Half Dome and avoid the permit lottery @59NationalParks @NatlParkService
I’m here from just across the northern Washington border! @59NationalParks @Flow397
Please give @AltNatParkSer a follow! The folks behind this account are brilliant. #parkchat #hikerchat #nps101 https://t.co/Lgye4VgFOU
#FindYourPark photo challenge "This is My America!" Mine=@YosemiteNPS first view of Half Dome #parkchat https://t.co/ZxnU098hGJ
Chiming in super late to #hikerchat but still love reading the threads. Hope I can participate proper one day @TETONsports @danjourneytweet
A1 #hikerchat Lived in Edmonton, AB for 8 yrs. -20 day x-country skiing in Jasper was tough on the digits @TETONsports
A3 #hikerchat I don't feel like winter's over yet! We plan snowshoe trips in the mountains thru April #PNW @TETONsports
@Hiker_Steve @Bernardine Can't wait!
These made me laugh! #hikerchat https://t.co/o8VjLFNSPT
Is your New Year's resolution to hike more? I've got some ideas and inspiration for you! https://t.co/V04ngApjDJ #hikerchat #resolutions
Thanks @59NationalParks & @Flow397 for the awesome discussion questions! Looking forward to next week! #parkchat @ParksandPoints
@rscottjones @pubclub @DWoutside @Stars252525 @59NationalParks We often search for a craft brewery near our trailhead! #parkchat
A11 #ParkChat Seldom plan ahead. Got messed up @YosemiteNPS with that approach tho. Missed out on Glacier Pt :( @59NationalParks @Flow397
@Flow397 @WildWithinHer Tons and tons of planning & prep. I have some tips and ideas on my JMT blog https://t.co/slfS6cmuPK #parkchat
A10 #Parkchat 2/2 In Canada, Pacific Rim, Jasper Nat'l Park, and Gros Morne in Nfld are hopeful possibilities! @ParksCanada @Flow397
A10 #ParkChat If I get it all, then PCT thru Washington, lots of time @Discover_MBS and @NCascadesNPS 1/2 @Flow397
@WildWithinHer It was interesting planning 21 days of vegetarian backpacking food for the JMT. I think I eat better on trail! #parkchat
@grovergirl72 I love the big indulgent dinner after a day on trail! #parkchat
A9 #ParkChat Have some favs that we reuse regularly. Love to visit Trader Joe's before a camping trip @59NationalParks @MissouriHowell
@JrRangerTigran @Flow397 I've been keeping track for the last few years. Hike, location, distance, weather, trail condition, etc #parkchat
A8 #ParkChat Racked up 400 miles last year. Hope to break 500 in 2017! @Flow397
@59NationalParks Of course! But we only got to list 5 things... Really want a new multitool! #ParkChat
A7 #ParkChat Also really like visiting Ranger Stns and getting first-hand info and looking at real maps #oldschool @59NationalParks
A7 #ParkChat I spend a lot of time on @WTA_hikers website. Read hike descriptions & recent trip reports @59NationalParks
A6 #ParkChat A little. Now it's time to focus on #Canada150 and visit nearby @ParksCanada for free! @Flow397
@59NationalParks @Flow397 I find I can move a bit faster with them, and have saved my ankles many many times #parkchat
@WildWithinHer Aww thanks!!! I'll take you up on that for some southern WA exploring.
@Flow397 @WildWithinHer I hope the reservation system works this year! What a crazy mess last year. #parkchat
@WildWithinHer I'm up for it! Made it up Excelsior Peak on Mt Baker hwy Saturday in snowshoes! #parkchat
A5 #ParkChat Camera, tent, pack, fav boots and trekking poles! @59NationalParks @Flow397
@WildWithinHer @Flow397 That's an awesome challenge. Still haven't ventured near there but it's high on the list! #parkchat
A4 #ParkChat Training hikes in @NCascadesNPS on some of the super steep trails, like Sourdough Mtn https://t.co/TdmJBL8Bss @Flow397
@ramblRramblR Order your free DiscoveryPass now from @ParksCanada to streamline your visits: https://t.co/vfNU7oMw0b
@1zestytraveler Our mountain trails are steep for sure! Just keep walking and find as many hills/stairs as you can #ParkChat
A3 #ParkChat Always plan lots of hiking in the Parks so stay in hiking shape w/ the help of the gym & snowshoeing! @59NationalParks
A2 #ParkChat Def the weather! Tend to overpack for weather in the Pac NW and still sometimes get caught out. @Flow397
A1 #ParkChat 2/2 Canadian Nat'l Parks are free this year so hope to visit a few of those too! #Canada150 @ParksCanada
A1 #ParkChat Hoping to hike the PCT thru WA, so will likely visit @MountRainierNPS and @NCascadesNPS. 1/2 https://t.co/PbkApZBBZ2
